thread.title: BMC elections 2017: Exit poll depicts close fight between BJP, Shiv Sena
thread.title_full: BMC elections 2017: Exit poll depicts close fight between BJP, Shiv Sena - The Financial Express

author: FE Online
title: BMC elections 2017: Exit poll depicts close fight between BJP, Shiv Sena
text:
Despite regular appeals by the candidates and well-meaning residents of Mumbai, the total voter turnout for the BMC polls has been 52.17% as the polling stopped at 6 pm. (PTI) As residents of Brihanmumbai today casted votes for to elect their leaders and politicals parties in the BMC polls, an exit poll by Axis-My India depicts close fight between Uddhav Thackeray â€™s Shiv Sena and Bharatiya Janata Party ( BJP ), as the two parties continue their fight for seats and prestige. The Exit poll shows Shiv Sena to clinch 89-92 seats and Congress 30-34 seats of the 227 wards.
Despite regular appeals by the candidates and well-meaning residents of Mumbai, the total voter turnout for the BMC polls has been 52.17% as the polling stopped at 6 pm. Even though this is not a new trend and Mumbaikars are known for their apathy, this time over a lot of efforts were made to have a bigger voter turnout. Chief Minister, Devendra Fadnavis made fervent appeals to the residents to come in large numbers and exercise their right to vote.
Polling for 227 seats of Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai continued till 6 pm, where a total of 17,331 candidates are in the fray for 3,210 seats in 10 municipal corporations. The civic body polls witnessed voters from political, Bollywood and sports fraternity.
